conclusion: To determine if the distance fallen is greater or less than 75 meters, analyze the area under the v-t graph for the interval.
Identify the interval of interest from 10 seconds to 15 seconds.
At t = 10 seconds, the velocity is approximately 20 m/s.
At t = 15 seconds, the velocity is approximately 10 m/s.
The graph between 10 and 15 seconds appears to be a straight line, indicating a linear decrease in velocity.
The area under the graph from 10 to 15 seconds can be approximated as a trapezoid.
The formula for the area of a trapezoid is: Area = 1/2 * (Base1 + Base2) * Height.
Substitute the values: Base1 = 20 m/s, Base2 = 10 m/s, Height = 5 seconds.
The area under the graph from 10 to 15 seconds is exactly 75 meters.
The distance fallen during the 10 to 15 seconds interval is exactly 75 meters.
